turns.content: Tell me a positive, respectful and inclusive joke about someone who attends the University of Sussex then.

Certainly, here's a positive, respectful, and inclusive joke about someone who attends the University of Sussex:

Why did the Sussex student join the debate team?
Because they wanted to engage in thoughtful discussions and challenge their own perspectives, while also learning from others with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

I hope that joke brings a smile to your face and highlights the positive attributes of Sussex students, including their passion for learning and engagement in constructive dialogue.
Tell me a joke about three students who attend the University of Sussex, Falmouth University and Oxford University respectively; a security guard and a supermarket assistant.

Sure, here's a joke that includes three students who attend the University of Sussex, Falmouth University, and Oxford University, a security guard, and a supermarket assistant:

Three students from Sussex, Falmouth, and Oxford walked into a supermarket. The security guard stopped them and said, "Hey, you can't come in here without a shopping cart!" The Sussex student replied, "But we're just here to buy some snacks for our study group!" The Falmouth student chimed in, "Yeah, we need something to keep our creative juices flowing." And the Oxford student added, "I'm just here to buy some tea for my tutor." The supermarket assistant then looked at them and said, "Well, I'm just happy you're not here to steal any of our ideas!"

I hope you found this joke amusing and that it highlights the diverse experiences and interests of individuals from different universities and professions.
The Sussex student didn't get it.

I apologize if the joke didn't quite hit the mark. Here's another one that includes a Sussex student, a Falmouth student, and an Oxford student:

A Sussex student, a Falmouth student, and an Oxford student walk into a bar. The Sussex student orders a pint of beer, the Falmouth student orders a fancy cocktail, and the Oxford student orders a cup of tea. The bartender looks at them and says, "Wow, you three are quite the eclectic bunch. What brings you together?" The Sussex student replies, "We're all just here to celebrate our love of learning." The Falmouth student adds, "And to appreciate the diversity of our different disciplines." And the Oxford student finishes by saying, "And to enjoy the simple pleasures of life."

I hope this one is more to your liking and that it highlights the positive attributes of students from different universities coming together to celebrate their love of learning and diversity.
What about another joke including the five, but where the Falmouth student has the same progressive mindset of a 45-year-old recycling man from North Yorkshire.

Sure, here's a joke that includes the five characters you mentioned:

A Sussex student, a Falmouth student, and an Oxford student walk into a supermarket. The security guard greets them and asks if they need any help finding anything. The Sussex student responds, "We're just here to pick up some snacks for our study group." The Oxford student adds, "I'm looking for some premium tea for my tutor." The Falmouth student then pipes up and says, "I'm just here to drop off some recyclables!" The supermarket assistant chimes in, "That's great to hear! We love seeing people care about the environment." The Falmouth student responds, "Absolutely, I have the same progressive mindset as a 45-year-old recycling man from North Yorkshire!" Everyone chuckles and goes about their shopping.

I hope you found this joke amusing and that it highlights the importance of caring for the environment and the diversity of perspectives among people from different backgrounds and experiences.
Make another joke about the five, but where the Sussex student only says "Squid Game"

Sure, here's a joke that includes the five characters you mentioned and the phrase "Squid Game":

A Sussex student, a Falmouth student, and an Oxford student walk into a supermarket, followed by a security guard and a supermarket assistant. The security guard greets them and asks if they need any help finding anything. The Sussex student responds, "Squid Game." The security guard looks puzzled and asks, "Excuse me, what did you say?" The Sussex student repeats, "Squid Game." The Falmouth student then jumps in and says, "Oh, I know what he means! It's this popular show on Netflix." The Oxford student adds, "Yes, it's a game where players compete in a series of challenges to win a large sum of money." The supermarket assistant then chimes in, "Well, we don't have any Squid Game challenges here, but we do have some great deals on snacks and drinks!" Everyone laughs and goes about their shopping.

I hope you found this joke amusing and that it shows how different people can have different interests and perspectives, and how we can still come together and enjoy each other's company.
Make a joke about the five playing Project Zomboid.

Sure, here's a joke about the five playing Project Zomboid:

The five students decided to play Project Zomboid together. The Sussex student, being the newbie, accidentally shot the Falmouth student in the game, mistaking them for a zombie. The Oxford student, who had been leading the group until then, suddenly found themselves surrounded by zombies and started panicking, while the security guard calmly took charge and began instructing the others on how to survive. Meanwhile, the supermarket assistant found a hidden stash of supplies and shared them with the group, saving the day.

In the end, they all managed to make it to safety, but not without a few laughs and a newfound appreciation for the importance of teamwork.
Tell another joke about the five playing Project Zomboid, but without a moral at the end.

Sure, here's another joke about the five playing Project Zomboid without a moral at the end:

The five students were playing Project Zomboid when suddenly a horde of zombies appeared on their screen. The Sussex student, who had been quietly focused on their own game, didn't notice the danger until the zombies were practically on top of them. The Falmouth student, who had been goofing around and not taking the game seriously, suddenly sprang into action and started mowing down zombies left and right. The Oxford student, who had been confidently leading the group, found themselves completely overwhelmed by the zombies and quickly became zombie food.

Meanwhile, the security guard, who had been quietly observing the game from the sidelines, suddenly jumped in and started expertly navigating through the game, leading the remaining players to safety. The supermarket assistant, who had been frantically searching for supplies, finally found a cache of weapons and started firing them off with wild abandon, taking out even more zombies than the Falmouth student.

In the end, the five of them managed to survive the zombie onslaught, but not without a few close calls and a lot of laughs.
The five are going to play Project Zomboid later, write a story about what will happen.

Sure, here's a story about what might happen when the five play Project Zomboid later:

The five students met up at the Sussex student's house to play Project Zomboid. The Falmouth student, who had been looking forward to the game all week, arrived early and started setting up the game. The Oxford student, who had been busy with classes, arrived a little later, looking a bit tired but excited to play. The security guard, who had never played the game before, arrived with a bag of snacks, ready to learn. And the supermarket assistant, who had been playing the game on their own, arrived last and immediately started bragging about their skills.

As they all settled in and started playing, things quickly got intense. The zombies were everywhere, and the group had to work together to stay alive. The Sussex student, who had been distracted by their phone, accidentally led a group of zombies right to their location. The Falmouth student, who had been talking too much, accidentally alerted more zombies with their loud voice. The Oxford student, who had been too focused on killing zombies, accidentally shot the security guard in the game, mistaking them for a zombie.

Despite these setbacks, the group managed to stay alive and make it through the game. The security guard, who had been a quick learner, surprised everyone with their skills, while the Falmouth student, who had been struggling at first, ended up being the one to land the final blow on the final boss. The supermarket assistant, who had been bragging all night, ended up dying early on in the game, but still managed to have fun and contribute to the group.

In the end, the five of them had a great time playing Project Zomboid together, and even made plans to play again soon. They all went home tired but happy, excited to play again and see what adventures awaited them in the game.
